headline: Birth Control Now a Major Part of U.S. Aid

headline: BIRTH CONTROL STIRS PENNSYLVANIA FIGHT
snippet: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 18 -- A state program to make birth control information and services available to Pennsylvanians who are on relief stirred a controversy today.

headline: U.S. to Give Turkey Birth Control Help; U.S. TO GIVE TURKS BIRTH CONTROL AID
snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 -- The United States is preparing to take its first direct step toward helping other countries curb population growth through birth control.

headline: Birth Control Group Pickets

headline: Council Leaves Way Open to Vatican Shift on Birth Control
snippet: ROME, Nov. 30 -- Papal amendments to an Ecumenical Council document dealing with birth control have been "absorbed" in a way to leave open the possibility of future modification of the Roman Catholic Church's ban on artificial contraception.

headline: A HOME TEST AIDS IN BIRTH CONTROL; Hormone Levels Recorded for Rhythm Method Users
snippet: Two Boston physicians have developed a simple home test that, they say, acts as a reliable chemical calendar for women using the rhythm method of birth control.

headline: Birth Control Scholar; Richard Newton Gardner
snippet: STROLLERS in the balmy weather of Washington's Rock Creek Park yesterday afternoon might have seen a scholarly looking man in a gray tweed suit rambling on horseback along the bridle paths.

headline: Birth Control Prohibition Reaffirmed by Pope Paul; POPE AFFIRMS BAN ON BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: ROME, Nov. 26 -- Pope Paul VI has directed the Ecumenical Council to make a specific restatement of the Roman Catholic Church's prohibition against chemical or mechanical methods to prevent conception.

headline: Moderate Papal Statement On Birth Control Foreseen
snippet: Pope Paul VI probably will not deviate from the Roman Catholic Church's traditional stand against contraception when he issues his promised statement on birth control, according to the Catholic magazine, America.

headline: L.I. Court Dismisses Charge Of Promoting Birth Control
snippet: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 5 -Charges against a man arrested for illegally disseminating birth-control information and contraceptive devices were dismissed here today in Nassau County District Court.

headline: 1920 Birth Control Law an Issue In French Presidential Election
snippet: PARIS, Nov. 5 -- A forbidden little pill has become a big issue among the French presidential candidates, who hope to gain women's votes by giving them a legal right to use artificial means of birth control.

headline: Health Parley Asks U.S. Birth Control Aid for All; A Report on Family Planning Stresses Help for Poor
snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 -- The White House Conference on Health called on the Federal Government today to help provide birth control devices and instruction to all American families, particularly the poor.

headline: First Rural Area Gets U.S. Birth Control Aid; York County, Pa., Sets Up 2 Clinics With Help Given Under Antipoverty Plan
snippet: YORK, Pa., Nov. 1 --Birth control devices paid for by the Federal Government are being given to rural parents near here. Federal officials said the project was the first of its kind, in the antipoverty campaign, to offer birth control assistance...

headline: FRANCE ASKS STUDY OF BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: PARIS, Oct. 28 (Reuters) -- The French Government is making a study of birth control, including the safety of contraceptive pills, a Health Ministry spokesman said today.

headline: Snow Ball Gala Arranged in Aid Of Birth Control; Planned Parenthood of Manhattan and Bronx Lists Nov. 12 Event
snippet: Officials of Planned Parenthood of Manhattan and the Bronx are planning the Snow Ball, a dinner dance to be held on Nov. 12 in the Grand Ballroom of the Sheraton-East.

headline: MEETING DISCUSSES BIRTH-CONTROL PILLS
snippet: A scientific study of a Planned Parenthood program offering contraceptive pills to 14,000 women in the Chicago area shows that 70 to 83 per cent continued to use them for 30 months without special encouragement.

headline: Pope on Birth Control
snippet: F Steegmuller lr queries whether Pope's statement is 'nonpartisan,'

headline: Birth Control Advocate in U.S. Post

headline: 2 to Get Award for Helping To Kill Birth-Control Ban
snippet: Two persons instrumental in having the Supreme Court strike down last June the 1879 Connecticut birth-control law, forbidding the use of contraceptives by anyone, will receive the Albert L. Lasker Award of the Albert and Mary Laker Foundation.

headline: Pope's Remarks on Birth Control Not Interpreted as New Ruling
snippet: ROME, Oct. 4 -- The impression here of the Pope's references to birth control in his United Nations speech was that they constituted a valid indication of the trend of his thinking on the issue, but not a final ruling.

headline: U.S. CATHOLIC UNIT URGES A RESTUDY OF BIRTH CONTROL; But Group's Effort to Get Views to Papal Commission Have Been Frustrated RESTUDY IS URGED ON BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: ROME, Sept. 27 -- A group of 37 American Roman Catholic scholars has given qualified endorsement to contraception and suggested a change in the church's traditional position on birth control.

headline: Prelate Urges Vatican Council To Reach Stand on Birth Control
snippet: ROME, Sept. 22 -- A plea for speedy clarification of the Roman Catholic stand on birth control was voiced by an Italian prelate today in the Ecumenical Council.

headline: Birth-Control Talk No Longer Taboo at Parley
snippet: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 5 -- Many of the 700 specialists from 70 countries at the population conference of the United Nations here are talking about birth control in a matter-of-course manner that was unthinkable not many years ago.

headline: COURT CRITICIZED ON BIRTH CONTROL; Group Supports the Decision but Assails the Reasoning

snippet: There was something unpleasantly familiar yesterday about the headlines linking the Roman Catholic bishops with an attack on a birth control program.

headline: Frankness on Birth Control in Latin America

snippet: conf urges govts make birth control methods available on request

headline: Advertising: On the Matter of Birth Control
snippet: The Emko Company appears to be breaking some new ground in what has been a rather sensitive area of advertising -birth control.

headline: India Begins Production of Birth-Control Device; First Factory Is Dedicated at Kanpur -- Will Produce 14,000 Loops a Day
snippet: KANPUR, India, Aug. 9 -India began production of the much-heralded Lippes loop today.

headline: Massachusetts Kills Plan To Ease Birth Control Ban
snippet: BOSTON, Aug. 2 (AP) -- The Massachusetts House killed a proposal today to exempt physicians and pharmacists from most provisions of the state law barring dissemination of birth control devices and information.

headline: Teaching Birth Control

headline: Birth Control Working in India, Bowles Says at Senate Hearing; He Backs Bill to Coordinate Federal Dissemination of Information on Subject
snippet: WASHINGTON, July 28 -- Government-sponsored birth control is beginning to take hold in India and gives promise of success in other developing countries, Ambassador Chester Bowles told a Senate subcommittee on population control today.

headline: Jersey Refuses to Relax Rule on Birth Control Aid
snippet: TRENTON, July 28 (AP) -- The State Institutions Board rejected a proposal today to modify New Jersey's policy on birth control information.

headline: India Attempts New Approach To Birth Control
snippet: NEW DELHI, July 17 -- Not so long ago, a birth control worker in New Delhi celebrated the birth of his 10th child.

headline: Birth Control Drive Has Wide Response By South Koreans

snippet: WASHINGTON, June 29 (AP) -- Dr. John Rock of Brookline, Mass., testified today that "present population growth rates on this planet present an obviously lethal threat to all that civilization has achieved."

headline: NOBEL LAUREATES PETITION THE POPE; 81 Prize Winners Ask for Reconsideration of Stand Against Birth Control BIRTH CURB PLEA IS MADE TO POPE

snippet: WASHINGTON, June 19 -- The Department of the Interior became today the first Federal agency to offer direct birth-control advice and services, including contraceptives.

headline: Legislature Voids Birth Control Ban, In Effect 84 Years; ALBANY VOIDS BAN ON BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: ALBANY, June 16 -- A bill that would end the state's 84-year-old law against the dissemination of birth control devices and information won final passage today in the Legislature. Governor Rockefeller declined to say whether he would sign it.

snippet: ALBANY, June 14 -- A bill that would all but repeal New York's 84-year-old law banning the sale or distribution of birth-control devices and information was approved overwhelmingly today by the Senate.

headline: LAW: COURT BANS BIRTH CONTROL CURBS

headline: Bill for Liberalizing New York Statute Goes to the State Senate; State Senate Gets a Birth Control Bill
snippet: A bill to liberalize New York State's 1881 law against the dissemination of birth-control devices and information about them was reported out of the State Senate Rules Committee yesterday, with enhanced chances of passage.

headline: BIRTH CONTROL AID GAINS IN ILLINOIS

snippet: WASHINGTON, May 24 -- A panel of scientists today urged a far-reaching birth-control program to extend the "basic human right" of family planning to all in the United States.

snippet: CHICAGO, May 4 -- Birth control by means of an hypodermic injection has emerged from limited clinical testing and is now undergoing a two-year trial that will involve about 5,000 women, physicians said today.

headline: Birth Control Diet for Pigeons Tested in Effort to Cut Number

headline: BIRTH CONTROL ISSUE

headline: Marital Status Becomes an Issue In High Court Birth-Control Case; MARITAL STATUS AN ISSUE IN COURT

headline: POPE ASKS RULING ON BIRTH CONTROL; Exhorts Study Panel to Act Soon on Issue Causing 'Anguish' to Many
snippet: ROME, March 29 -- Pope Paul VI has urged his commission of priests, scientists and laymen to recommend soon a Roman Catholic policy on birth control in response to "the anguish of so many souls" on the issue.

headline: City Expanding Birth Control Clinics
snippet: Birth control services to needy New York City families are growing dramatically because of a recent infusion of Federal funds and a more liberal interpretation of the criteria for maternal health.

snippet: CHICAGO, March 27 -- Tax-supported birth-control assistance in the form of advice, drugs and devices is increasing in all parts of the country.

headline: STATE AID VOTED ON BIRTH CONTROL; Welfare Board Will Provide Help to Unwed Recipients Who Are Family Heads

headline: Michigan Starts Birth Control Plan, First for the State

headline: U.S. Gives Policy For Birth Control Under Foreign Aid

headline: BIRTH CONTROL AID ASSAILED UPSTATE; Albany County Officials Repel Easier State Policy

headline: 2d English Priest Punished For Favoring Birth Control
snippet: LONDON, Feb. 25 -- The second English Roman Catholic priest within a week was disciplined today for expressing views in favor of birth control. He was barred from preaching.

headline: British Priest Flies to Rome After Defending Birth Control
snippet: LONDON, Feb. 20. The Rev. Arnold A. McMahon, a Roman Catholic priest who wrote an article supporting birth control, flew to Rome today to see his superiors.

headline: U.S. CHIDED AS TIMID OVER BIRTH CONTROL

snippet: CHICAGO, Feb. 17 -- The Chicago Board of Health started a birth control program today in its own clinics, open to all, regardless of income or married status.

headline: BIRTH-CONTROL AID IS MILD BRITISH ISSUE

snippet: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 1 -- A plan to establish birth-control clinics here under the Federal antipoverty program has again become the target of criticism from Roman Catholics and some doctors.

headline: A.M.A. to Give Doctors Birth-Control Reports
snippet: CHICAGO, Jan. 22 (AP) -- The American Medical Association said today it would send information on various aspects of human reproduction and population control to the nation's physicians sometime this year.

headline: U.S. EXPANDS ROLE IN BIRTH CONTROL; Health Aide Says Federal Help Is Offered to All

snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 -- A single sentence in President Johnson's State of the Union Message prompted a Roman Catholic official today to restate the church's opposition to most aspects of birth control.

headline: City's Clinics for Birth Control And Maternal Care Expanded
snippet: An expansion of the city's services for family planning and comprehensive maternal care was announced yesterday by Dr. George James, Commissioner of the Department of Health.

headline: U.S. AIDING TEXAS IN BIRTH CONTROL; Federal Funds Likely to Be Given Other Applicants

headline: Milwaukee Agency Approves 4 Clinics For Birth Control
snippet: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 4 -- The Social Development Commission of Greater Milwaukee approved today a plan for birth-control clinics. The plan had received wide attention and aroused opposition from some Milwaukee Catholics.
